Comment:
Hi everyone!

I have been playing in Gothicgirl's mamouth mini-tournament.  In this match I come up against a former International Master.  A few ill-judged exchanges had disastrous consequences for me and I ended up resigning the game on the grounds of ruinous loss of material.  Any attempt to have avoided this loss would have resulted in Henry being buried six feet under.  Here comes a standard Sicilian Defence from the WIM.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
4. ....... Nf6 - development.
5. ....... a6 - this move is the Sicilian Naijdorf.
5. ....... a6 - this move is the Sicilian Naijdorf.
7.......... Be7 - development.
7.......... Be7 - development.
7.......... Be7 - development.
7.......... Be7 - development.
9. 0-0 - both sides castle kingside.
9. 0-0 - both sides castle kingside.
9. 0-0 - both sides castle kingside.
11. Bf1 - would Bb3 have been an improvement.
11. Bf1 - would Bb3 have been an improvement.
11. Bf1 - would Bb3 have been an improvement.
11. Bf1 - would Bb3 have been an improvement.
14. Nd5? - here is where I start to go wrong.  In retrospect I should have kicked that horsie out of g4 with h3.  I think this is where that move h3 is appropriate.

15. ...... Qb6 - an excellent move, nasty double attack on the f pawn.
15. ...... Qb6 - an excellent move, nasty double attack on the f pawn.
15. ...... Qb6 - an excellent move, nasty double attack on the f pawn.
16. ...... Rac8 - preparing to play Rc5 - attacking the weak d5 pawn.
16. ...... Rac8 - preparing to play Rc5 - attacking the weak d5 pawn.
17. Rc1 - preparing c4.
18. Rd2?? - this moves drops the d pawn.  In retrospect I had to try c4 here.
18. Rd2?? - this moves drops the d pawn.  In retrospect I had to try c4 here.

19. Rxd5?? - I now dig myself deeper into the mire.  It is only after I took on d5 and pressed the submit button that I saw the deadly Nf2 threatening a discovery.  Here are two variations that lose - anything else and Glenda drops.

Variation A 19. Rxd5 Nxf2 20. Qe2 Nd3+ 21. Kh1 Nxc1 22. Qd1 Nxd5 23. Qxc1. Variation B 19. Rxd5 Nxf2 20. Rxd6 Nh3+ 21. Kh1 Qg1+ 22. Nxg1 Nf2#.  Yup this is where Henry is buried Six Feet Under, a brilliant Smothered Mate.

After this analysis, due to my opponent's OPTIMUM RATING I knew that she would not miss that so I waved the white flag.

I hope I can put up a better show against her as black.
